name: Penguin Random House
description: One of the largest book publishers in the world, Penguin Random House publishes a wide range of books across multiple genres, from literary fiction to popular non-fiction.

name: HarperCollins
description: A global publisher with a wide range of imprints, HarperCollins publishes books for adults, children, and young adults. Some of its most well-known authors include Neil Gaiman, J.R.R. Tolkien, and J.K. Rowling.

name: Simon & Schuster
description: A leading publisher of both fiction and non-fiction books, Simon & Schuster has a long history of publishing bestselling books, including To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee and The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger.

name: Hachette Book Group
description: A division of Hachette Livre, the second-largest book publisher in the world, Hachette Book Group publishes books across multiple genres, including mystery, romance, and science fiction.

name: Macmillan Publishers
description: A global publisher with multiple imprints, Macmillan publishes books across a wide range of genres, including children's books, romance, and science fiction.

name: Scholastic Corporation
description: The world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, Scholastic Corporation publishes books for children of all ages, from picture books to young adult novels.

name: Bloomsbury Publishing
description: A leading independent publisher with a focus on literary fiction and non-fiction, Bloomsbury Publishing has published books by many notable authors, including J.K. Rowling and Khaled Hosseini.

name: Penguin Group
description: An imprint of Penguin Random House, Penguin Group is a well-known publisher of literary fiction and non-fiction, including works by Jane Austen and George Orwell.

name: W.W. Norton & Company
description: A publisher of college textbooks and other educational materials, W.W. Norton & Company also publishes general interest books across multiple genres, including history, science, and literature.

name: Random House
description: An imprint of Penguin Random House, Random House publishes a wide range of fiction and non-fiction, including books by bestselling authors such as Dan Brown and John Grisham.
